title: Instructional Design Techniques and Achievement Motivation Development Program Utilizing Cooperative Learning and Electronic Interactions Based on Teaching Anchors

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Expert training course in language education domains based on asynchronous/synchronous interaction environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can design one language education module by applying instructional design techniques (e.g., goal setting, assessment tool development).
Learners can revise instructional design drafts at least twice using peer feedback in a collaborative learning environment.
Learners demonstrate a 20% or greater improvement in self-efficacy as measured by pre- and post-achievement motivation scales.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
